What We're Like

BIG W's best and most valued asset is its staff. We believe one of the most vital elements of driving success is our people and empowering our workforce to meet their goals and extend their skills is a big part of our business.
  • Unbeatable teams, unbeatable opportunity
  • Implement change initiatives and deliver on growth opportunities
  • Build relationships with community and key stakeholders
The Role

The Store Manager leads the store team to deliver the best shopping experience for our customers. You will be responsible for achieving sales targets by ensuring labour is allocated and routines are in place ensuring the right stock in the right place at the right time, merchandised according to Company standards and customers are served in a friendly and efficient manner.

About You

Your self-motivated nature will allow you to meet deadlines and oversee budgets in a rapidly changing environment. You will also have demonstrated leadership and motivational prowess.

    • Plan and execute delivery of the BIG W strategy

    BIG W is a modern, Australian Discount Department Store. WIth a heritage dating back to 1964 and now 186 stores across Australia we are proud of of our 52 year history. Job description

About us


Want to join one of Australia’s fastest growing fintechs?\xa0 We have multiple roles for experienced Software Developers to join our talented team.


Moula is a better way to borrow money to grow your business. Once upon a time, getting a business loan meant spending 6-8 weeks filling in forms and then waiting around for approval. With Moula, you can apply online with no paperwork and no hassle, and have the funds in your account the next day.


We’ve developed a unique platform that will analyse a business’ data, making the process simple, fast, and friendly. But we’re not just a smart algorithm; we’re all about human interaction, which is why we have a team of real people who will get to know each business’ unique needs. Founded in Australia by an experienced team who are passionate about using technology to simplify finance, Moula continues to lead the market with our transparent pricing and responsible lending practices.


About the position

As we are a fast growth fintech creating our own product in house you will be working with the latest technology in an agile scrum environment. \xa0We are looking for flexible, team players who are self starters with a passionate interest in technology and innovative practices. This role will be a mix of developing new functionality and enhancing existing systems. \xa0

This includes:

  • Hands on software development and automated testing

  • Coordinating with internal resources and stakeholders in an Agile environment, \xa0ensuring that projects are delivered incrementally and always being able to pivot in order to deliver maximum value

  • Being involved in the design and evolution of our software platform

  • We build, test, deploy and maintain all of our software in a very DevOps mentality (there is no separate Ops team)

  • We believe in using the right tool for the job


About you

  • You are an experienced software developer, \xa0with excellent communication skills and a team-oriented approach

  • You have a \xa0passion for software engineering and best practices, and a \xa0willingness to mentor and work with developers at all levels of experience

  • You will be happy to make suggestions for improvements not only to the code but the whole tech stack and process used to deliver software

  • You have an active interest in new developments in I.T. and love to learn and bring new ideas to the team

  • You will have extensive experience with .Net technologies and the Microsoft development stack

  • Front end experience (any javascript framework) highly desirable

  • You'll also have experience with Agile processes

\xa0

Your skills

  • .Net software development, C# MVC, Web API

  • Angular (2+) or other Javascript platforms and nodejs

  • Agile methodology

  • Azure platform and/or experience with other cloud providers

  • Continuous integration and deployment

  • Database development, specifically SQL Server

  • Understanding of different types of architecture, like event based models and microservices

\xa0

We offer

  • An exciting opportunity to be a part of building our business

  • A relaxed, fun, friendly and supportive culture

  • A commitment to continuous learning and sponsored training

  • A flat structure with lots of autonomy and flexibility

  • Opportunities to advance your career and develop your skills and knowledge

  • Working in a small but growing team will allow you to put forward your ideas, try them out and see them implemented

\xa0\xa0

for more information about us please visit www.moula.com.au

Company Name Catch.com.au Company Location Bentleigh East, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 33 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

At Catch.com.au we know what it is like to work for a company with genuine 'X' factor. We are proud to be agile, disruptive, and unconventional...oh and did we mention we also lead the way and continuously innovate the eCommerce sector in Australia? We do that too!

Our websites include catch.com.au, scoopon.com.au, mumgo.com.au, groceryrun.com.au, bovoyage.com.au and PumpkinPatch.com.au. All have been built with the simple mission: to offer Australians the latest and greatest products and services every single day at unbeatable prices. That's why we have over 4 million members...and rising!


A BIT ABOUT THE JOB...

We are seeking to appoint an enthusiastic Buying Coordinator to support our superbly talented buying team based here at our Bentleigh East HQ.

Key to the position will be supporting the buying team in all things administrative. Working with both local and international suppliers you will be responsible for coordinating their buying activities, including but will not be limited to:

  • The collection of product information, images and samples from suppliers;
  • Preparation of submission forms for Purchase Order creation;
  • Managing and maintaining Purchase Order information, ensuring all relevant documentation has been provided and expected delivery dates are met;
  • Organising payments to suppliers as per payment terms.


We need a person that has true attention to detail, has advanced Excel skills and can prioritise their diverse and varied workload.

In summary, the position is a fantastic introduction to a buying team, it is very diverse, extremely fast-paced and an amazing opportunity to work with an Australian success story!

To be considered, you will ideally hold a relevant tertiary qualification and have experience in product management. Stock control experience is not necessary; however, it would be highly regarded.

Along with advanced Excel skills you'll be well versed in 'Office' and will have worked within a commercial environment. In addition, you will bring an unwavering attention to detail, product knowledge and an eagerness to succeed.


With an onsite coffee shop, breakout areas, and free WiFi our offices are geared towards those that enjoy work and life in equal measure.

If this sounds like the challenge you have been looking for we'd love to hear from you!

Project Manager-Captial Works

Company Name RMIT University Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 111 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Project Manager-Captial Works
Job no: 570359
Work type: Full time - Continuing/Permanent
Categories: Building and Property Services
  • Full time, Permanent Position
  • $85,065-$92,077+ 17% Super
  • Convenient CBD location

Our Organisation

RMIT is a global university of technology, design and enterprise. Our mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation, teaching and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for our students, getting them ready for life and work.

Property Services is located in the Operations Portfolio which is the services nucleus of RMIT and the focus for the development of the finance, people development infrastructure and systems that provide administrative capacity to the University.

The Role & Your Responsibilities

The Project Manager is responsible for the delivery of allocated complex projects under the direction of management and under the supervision of the Senior Manager and Program Leader or Senior Project Manager.

The role will be capable of handling 3-5 projects at the same time and have a good understanding of various project management practices. This role will be responsibilities for investigating project user requirements, estimating project costing, monitoring the progress of projects and providing more complex technical expertise with the ability to resolve any issues or discrepancies.

This role will liaise with a variety of stakeholders across RMIT University and will liaise with external contacts such as architects, engineers, quality surveyors, building surveyors and contractors.

The Project Manager will work within the Capital Works Team and support the Senior Manager and Program Leader by applying best practice at all times and ensuring efficient and prompt delivery of service is achieved. This role will provide high level essential administrative tasks and maintain a high degree of internal and external customer service.

Skills & Experience Required
  • Knowledge and experience in managing and delivering a number of projects at the same time, meeting deadlines, quality standards and cost parameters, within a large complex organisation.
  • Demonstrated ability to inform, engage and coordinate with internal / external stakeholders such as consultants, stakeholders and contractors in a high volume work environment.
  • Good standard of verbal and written skills, negotiation and interacting skills with the ability to adapt styles of communication to suit all levels.
  • Demonstrated experience in providing regular updates on project progressions and outcomes
  • Thorough technical knowledge of all construction / professional disciplines conversant with the Victorian Building Regulations, Work cover, Occupational Health and Safety and other relevant standards.
  • Ability to manage the performance of contracts, programs and projects and effectively deliver results on time, and within budget for more than one project at a time.
  • Ability to understand and translate User requirements into sound technical specifications.

To ApplyTo view a position description, please visit http://yourcareer.rmit.edu.au and search using job #570359

Business and Operations Manager

Company Name Swinburne University of Technology Company Location Hawthorn, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 36 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

• Manage the daily operations of our new Research Centre

• Make a real impact in the community and at Swinburne

• Starting from $95,919 + 17% super, 5 year contract


About the job
Swinburne University of Technology has been awarded funding by the Australian Research Council (ARC) to establish and operate the ARC Industrial Transformation Training Centre for Surface Engineering for Advanced Materials (SEAM) over five years in partnership with other universities, research organisations and industry partners. This will resolve a core need in all manufacturing sectors that controls the efficiency, productivity and sustainability of Australian industry and will be the role model for industry-university cooperation for applied training within an industrial setting.

In order to meet the Centre’s objectives, we have created the role of Business and Operations Manager. Overseeing the day to day operation of the Centre, you will contribute to the strategic direction of the Centre and its research training programs to ensure successful implementation of the Centre and realisation of its impact for the industry and community. Working in close partnership with the Director, senior researchers and technical and representatives from local and international partner organisations. With your previous operations experience, you will be manage the Centre’s complex budgets and guide the Director with the executing the operational plan over the next 5 years. The position is wide-ranging and highly stimulating: it will provide an opportunity to make a real impact in terms of Swinburne achieving its vision to be a leading science, technology and innovation university.

About Swinburne\xa0
Swinburne is a progressive university that aims to increase Australia’s capacity in science, technology and innovation as the drivers of modern, internationalised economies and workplaces. Our university is focused on high-impact global research, high-quality teaching and active engagement with both industry and the community.

The recently awarded ARC Industrial Transformation Training Centre for Surface Engineering for Advanced Materials (SEAM) is be one of the largest training centres of its kind in Australia, delivering commercial benefits for industry.
To find out more, visit: https://www.swinburne.edu.au/news/latest-news/2018/08/new-839-million-training-centre-in-surface-engineering-for-advanced-materials.php\xa0

About you
To be successful in the role, you will have:

• Demonstrated experience in the management and administration of complex research projects/ programs with proven ability to ensure effective completion of tasks within deadlines.

• Excellent interpersonal skills, with the ability to foster effective working relationships, build and maintain effective networks; ability to work effectively with stakeholders both internal and external.

• Demonstrated substantial budget management skills and experience, including the ability to develop and monitor complex budgets, provide financial models and understand and interpret financial reports.

Furthermore, your previous experience has equipped you to work with a variety of stakeholders and be responsive to their needs.

A full list of the selection criteria is available within the position description

Benefits

• Participate in regular staff and management development programs

• Hawthorn Aquatic and Leisure Centre (HALC) discounted memberships

• Salary package your car parking, superannuation and vehicle lease plans. It can help you get the most value from what you earn.

Discover more discounts when you start at Swinburne. Receive movie tickets and staff membership options at the Swinburne bookshop. Theres news subscriptions and computer and software discounts on offer.

Further information and how to apply
The diverse culture within Swinburne is a source of strength. We are proud to be recognised by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality 2018 and of key initiatives such as our Pride@Swinburne Strategic Action Plan and our Reconciliation Action Plan which are integral components of our 2025 vision to be world class university creating social and economic impact through science, technology and innovation. Swinburne has also received the Victorian “High Commendation” Multicultural Excellence Award (Business Category).

To view the position description or to start an application click on apply' at the bottom of this page and submit a resume and cover letter which addresses your experience in relation to the key selection criteria, as listed in the Position Description.

Please do not email or send paper applications, all applications must be submitted online.

For further information about the position, please contact Ania Gruba (Recruitment Consultant) on +613 9214 4856.

If you are experiencing technical difficulties with your application, please contact the Recruitment team on staffrecruitment@swin.edu.au\xa0

Should you require further support for an interview due to special needs or consideration, please contact our Diversity Consultant, Dr. Walter Robles, on inclusion@swin.edu.au, or our Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Employment Officer, Sherrin Trautmann on DeadlyCareers@swin.edu.au.


Applications close at 5pm on Monday 24th September 2018.

835035164:
[

Refugee Health Team Coordination and Support worker

Company Name cohealth Company Location Footscray, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 92 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Part-time 0.6-0.8 EFT (negotiable)

Fixed Term until August 2019

Based in Footscray


Greetings!


We are delighted that you are taking an interest in working for cohealth. We can offer you a position to work with a great team of people and be supported in a caring, family friendly environment. Cohealth is a values driven organisation at the forefront of multi-disciplinary team based community care. If you are looking for an opportunity to work closely with the local community and are committed to providing support and assistance to those who have poor access to services - then this is the place for you!


  • Role diversity and internal career progression opportunities
  • A supportive, flexible and autonomous work environment
  • Opportunity to be a valued member of a multi-disciplinary team
  • Commitment to support and professional development opportunities delivered by a dedicated Quality, Performance and Innovation team


Out program profile:


Our Refugee and Asylum Seeker Health Program supports the health and wellbeing of people of Refugee and Asylum Seeker background, with particular focus on those accessing services in the Cities of Maribyrnong, Moonee Valley and Yarra.

Our Program focuses on health assessment, care co-ordination, capacity building, advocacy, education and the provision of person-centred culturally responsive health services. The service is delivered by a team of Refugee Health Nurses, Coordination Support Workers, Counsellors, Women's Health Nurses and Physiotherapists working closely with internal and external service providers.


About the role:


Within this role you will work in a team providing a service which supports the health and wellbeing of newly arrived people of Refugee and Asylum Seeker Background, living in the City of Maribyrnong. Concentrating on client case support and care co-ordination with an emphasis on client access to external community based and government services. Your duties and responsibilities will include;


  • Providing outreach assistance with clients to support their skills, development and ability to access services such as Centrelink, legal, employment and access services such as community groups;
  • Managing client intake, assessment, planning and discharge in relation to social support and community service needs e.g. Family violence services, Centrelink, legal, employment and housing;
  • Supporting and coordinating the provision of care for clients with other settlement, welfare and health providers, which may often be complex in nature, and require advocacy and coordination for periods of time up to one year;
  • Building and maintaining good working relationships with staff at a range of health and welfare agencies such as Settlement Services; and
  • Developing and delivering community based projects in collaboration with Community Engagement worker.


With well-developed communication skills including cross-cultural communication, liaising comfortably with a range of internal and external stakeholders. You are an apt problem solver, capable of troubleshooting on your feet. To be suitable for this position, your qualifications, skills and experience for the role will consist of:


  • Tertiary qualifications in welfare, community development, Social Work, or similar;
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills;
  • Ability to establishes respectful professional relationships that have clear boundaries with consumers, staff and partner organisations;
  • Experienced working with clients from Refugee and Asylum Seeker backgrounds; and
  • Sound knowledge of principles of cultural safety and principles and practice related to service delivery for people from Refugee and Asylum Seeker background (desirable).


People from refugee and asylum seeker background are encouraged to apply


We are committed to a high performance, engaging team culture and investing in our people enables a rewarding career. If you have what we are looking for, do not delay - APPLY NOW


Who is cohealth?

For more information about cohealth and the services provided, please visit our website: www.cohealth.org.au


This position will be paid under the Community Health Centre (Stand Alone Services) Social and Community Service Employees Multi Enterprise Agreement 2013 - 2015 Community Development Worker Class 2B (SCHADS Level 4)


To be considered for the role, you're required to provide a CV demonstrating your skills and experience relevant to the position description, along with a cover letter that answers these questions:


  • Why are you applying for this job? (Suggested word limit: 200 words);
  • What skills and experience do you bring to this role? (Suggested word limit: 300 words);
  • Describe your approach to client intake, assessment and care co-ordination? (Suggested word limit: 400 words);
  • Provide a case example describing how you have worked with a client from refugee and asylum seeker background to coordinate service and improve client outcomes (Suggested word limit: 500 words); and
  • Describe your experience and key achievements whilst working in community engagement projects with refugee and asylum seeker communities? (Suggested word limit: 300 words).


Applications close on 10th September @ 10.00pm


People accepting employment with cohealth are unable to access our services, some exemptions may apply.


Applications from people of culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds; equity target groups including women, people with disabilities, people who identify as LGBTIQ; and people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent, are encouraged.


The suitable applicant will be subject to the relevant pre-employment checks for appointment to positions (including provision of a valid Working with Children Check clearance number and criminal record history check)


To apply for this job go to: www.cohealthcareers.org.au/Jobs/ & enter ref code: 4326365. Internal Reference P0377

817029748:
[

Customer Service Officers - Customer and Client Engagement

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 220 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Various Part-Time, Fixed Term Positions up to 31 December 2019
  • Salary Range: $51,472 to $55,579 p.a (pro-rata part-time) plus superannuation
  • Location: Dandenong, Frankston & Rosebud


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer more than 400 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

You will be accountable for the provision of customer focused customer and enrolment services to meet customer needs and enhance Chisholm Institute’s business.

Your Key Accountabilities Will Be To
  • Provide timely and accurate assistance to all internal and external customers with general inquiries such as certificate collection, parking permits, general directions to ensure that the customer experience is positive
  • Provide enrolment administration support to students in a professional and engaging manner aligned to Chisholm’s Customer Service Guidelines
  • Provide customer-centred and professional service at all times to enhance customer satisfaction and maintain the professional image of the Institute
  • Provide engagement session support, ensuring pre-enrolment and enrolment compliance and efficient administration;
  • Provide enrolment administration support to students in a professional and engaging manner aligned to Chisholm’s Customer Service Guidelines
  • Ensure that fee payments are correct by accurately calculating fees based on enrolment details.
  • Assist students by preparing VET Student Loans and FEE-HELP applications
  • Attending Information Sessions, Enrolment Centres and manning Campus Front Desks to process student enrolments utilising appropriate systems and processes;

Dandenong and Frankston Positions
Positions are available part-time and full time

Mornington Peninsula (Rosebud) Positions
Positions are available part-time working five hours each day Monday to Friday

About You

You will have a relevant qualification at a minimum of post-secondary level or equivalent relevant experience

Crucial to your success is your exceptional customer service skills both face to face and via phone with a proven track record in a similar complex environment being beneficial. Working as part of a team is something you enjoy and you actively work with your team to achieve performance goals.

You will be an exceptional communicator with a high attention to detail and who has the ability to be take initiative and proactively manage customers. Collaborative by nature you will thrive in the fast paced, deadline driven environment and relish the opportunity of being a vital part of the continuing success of Chisholm.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications for this position close 9am Monday 27 August 2018

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • National Police Check
  • International Police Check (if applicable)
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact Tania Collins Team Leader – Customer Service, Customer & Client Engagement on +61 3 9238 8145.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

About the role

We seek an enthusiastic professional to join our close-knit Sales Team in promoting and selling the suite of Markinson products and services to prospective customers. Reporting to the General Manager, the Business Development Manager will be responsible for identifying, qualifying, engaging and ultimately closing new business opportunities in our target markets. Working closely with an Account Executive and other stakeholders, you will be required to achieve allocated sales targets, and ensure a sound commercial relationship is established with prospective customers.


This is a permanent full time position based in our Richmond, Melbourne office. The objective of this role is to assist with setting sales strategies to achieve organizational goals and to further expand our client base through the acquisition of great, like-minded businesses that we can help become more profitable and which can lead to excellent referrals. Your main duties and responsibilities will include:

  • Generation of system sales and related products and services
  • Achieve or exceed agreed yearly gross sales targets
  • Liaison and coordination with other internal teams
  • Presentation and delivery of pre-sales presentations and product demonstrations

  • Produce sales forecasts in accordance with Markinson’s Sales Methodology
  • Maintain consistent, professional customer service both internally and externally
  • National, interstate travel will be required


Skills and Experience

This role is a pivotal part of our service delivery. To succeed in this critical role, you will be able to demonstrate the following skills and experience:

What's in it for you?

The Company
As a peak body, our client of approximately 300 staff nationally, maintains a rich sixty-year history as a membership-based association representing both regional and national relevant industry interests.\xa0

The Role
Reporting to the Commercial Director, the main purpose of the role will be to develop and coordinate the partnership/ sponsorship program.\xa0 The three main areas this role will focus on include; 1) Partnerships, 2) Communications, and 3) Events.

On the partnership side, your first priority will be to 'know' your portfolio, to ascertain a pool of existing relationships, and to plan how to maintain those relationships as well as advance those relationships.\xa0 This component of the role requires a strong sales acumen demonstrating growth through budgets, and reporting.

In terms of communications, you will be responsible for formatting and distributing an 'e-News' and 'News' publication.\xa0 Both publications will have opportunity for advertising revenue, growth.\xa0 Additionally, flyers and ad-hoc requirements will need to be created (Dreamweaver) catering to industry events.

Working along side the Event Manager, you will also be required to assist in managing a busy schedule of approximately 25 - 30 events throughout the year.

The Qualifications, Skills & Experience
Ideally, you will have experience working in a similar national membership-based organisation, have tertiary qualifications (Marketing/ Events Management/ or Media) with displayed experience in:
  • Developing and managing partnerships, sponsorship, events and communication
  • Exemplary stakeholder management through well-honed soft skills
  • Multi-tasking, planning priorities, and organisation skills
  • Writing content to publication grade/ level
  • Adhering to KPI's (Budgets/ Increased Partners/ Partner retention)

We are looking for a Procurement Manager for a leading Retailer based in Melbourne.\xa0 Reporting to the Head of Procurement, you will have responsibility for a broad marketing portfolio including but not limited to; Media, Creative, Digital, Print, Visual Merchandise.\xa0 \xa0Thre is also a responsibility to lead other corporate categories as required.\xa0 A refresh of the brand has also injected more activity into the Marketing category.


You will be focused on cost reduction, reduction of risk, optimisation of performance and increased overall value from the supply base.\xa0 This role also monitors new innovations from suppliers.
Required:
5-10 years’ experience in procurement including extensive exposure to negotiations, market analysis, new supplier development, change management, business case development and process implementation.

If you are excited\xa0by a fast-paced and\xa0dynamic working environment, and you are looking to develop your career in procurement, this role could be just the role for you.\xa0

Job description

Who likes to wake up on a Monday happy? We are recruiting a Senior Financial Accountant (12 month contract) for one of the very best ASX names in the financial services industry. Renowned for placing employee wellbeing, flexibility and development at their core, which has translated into one of the highest employee retention rates. The environment is collaborative, inclusive, fun and social.


The role will entail the following, but not limited to:


Description

  • Internal and external financial reporting
  • Completing reporting requirements to support all aspects of group reporting
  • Quarterly regulatory reporting to APRA
  • Annual Statutory reporting to ASIC
  • Maintain the integrity of the general ledger
  • Monthly account reconciliations and month end close process
  • Preparing, reviewing and posting manual journals to accurately record financial transactions as a part of the aforementioned

  • Identify business improvement opportunities
  • Work closely with a fun and happy Financial Accounting team who will be there to support you

  • Chartered Accountant from Big 4 audit or advisory (at least 4+ years) is preferred but not essential
  • Exposure to Financial Services, either direct in house work experience as a Financial Accountant or as an external auditor or accountant
  • Ability to work (and thrive) in a fast paced and evolving environment
  • Strong communication skills
  • Strong attention to detail and ability to work to strict deadlines is essential

  • Work-life balance\xa0

  • Regular social activities
  • Fantastic mentors\xa0
  • Happy team culture\xa0


If this sounds like you, please apply today. We would love to hear from you.

833607304:
[

Biomedical Research Grants Manager

Company Name Movember Foundation Company Location Richmond, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 116 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Oversee the management of major peer-reviewed prostate cancer translational research initiatives
  • 18 month contract
  • Full time or part time opportunity


The Movember Foundation currently operates the Movember campaign in 21 countries, including Australia, USA, UK, Canada, New Zealand, Singapore and Hong Kong. Through the power of the moustache, we have created a global movement that is changing the face of men’s health.

\xa0

The Movember Foundation has invested over AUD$300 million in to prostate cancer biomedical research initiatives and as such, oversees a diverse program portfolio globally.

The Biomedical Research Grants Manager will report to the Global Director of Prostate Cancer Biomedical Research and will oversee the management of major peer-reviewed prostate cancer translational research initiatives. This is a hands-on grants/project management role.\xa0


Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Set up and manage a review panel comprising of leading clinicians and researchers (including managing any potential conflicts of interest)
  • Relationship management of key project stakeholders
  • Manage the Request For Applications (RFA) grant process from leading research institutions and universities
  • Liaise with the Principal Investigators at research institutions who have been short-listed for funding by the peer review panel
  • Arrange face-to-face and videoconference-based meetings between key project stakeholders
  • Provide reports to governance committees
  • Contract development and management of successful applications
  • Put in place performance measurement processes and reporting for successful applications

\xa0

The role may also take on other aspects of project coordination or management within the Movember Prostate Cancer Biomedical Research Portfolio as necessary.

\xa0

To be considered for this role you will have the following capabilities:

\xa0

  • A relevant degree in biomedical research
  • Direct experience coordinating and managing research projects
  • Experience in managing peer-reviewed grants applications would be very highly regarded
  • Team player with highly developed stakeholder management skills
  • Highly developed organisation skills and ability to prioritise
  • Ability to work in a fast paced and growth environment
  • Strong computer literacy skills
  • An understanding of cancer biology (desirable)
  • Project management experience, preferably in a translational research setting

\xa0

The role reports to the Global Director, Prostate Cancer Biomedical Research and will initially be offered as a 18 month contract.


This role could be full time or part time (0.6 or 0.8 FTE) depending on the person appointed.

This is a fantastic opportunity for a highly engaged person to join a rapidly growing, fast paced and highly energetic team so if you believe you have the necessary qualifications and experience to succeed in this role please forward your application and covering letter addressing the selection criteria by Thursday 6th September 2018 to jobs@movember.com \xa0

\xa0

  1. Why do you want to work at the Movember Foundation?
  2. Which of our values resonates most closely with you and why?

\xa0


\xa0

\xa0

\xa0

Project Lead - Reconciliations

Company Name Expert360 Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 104 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Role

We have 2 legacy operating systems. There has been a lapse in operational controls when people have keyed transactions which has resulted in a number of breaks. The problem is bigger than simply re-keying the data. We are looking for a capable, self motivated, experienced Melbourne based project manager to lead a reconciliation project focused on resolving this legacy reconciliation opportunity in a sustainable manner.


Ideal Consultant

This is a very hands-on project working with 2 people in the IT team. This role would suit a Senior Business Analyst/ Stream Lead/ Project Lead/ Project Manager who can demonstrate running smaller projects that have required the consultant to be "in the trenches".

  • Strong track record delivering projects that combine finance, process improvement, project delivery, and technology
  • Experience in financial accounting or reconciliations AND/OR experience in life insurance and an understanding as to how direct insurance products are sold
  • Highly motivated
  • Strong business acumen
  • Ability to build and maintain relationships across business functions
  • Excellent presentation and communication skills


Key Information

  • Duration: 6-12 months
  • Budget: ~$750-900 per day + GST. Please submit your proposed daily rate in your application.
